column4: that looks quite nasty. are you out of disk space or something?
Nope I've got tuns of space
unable to create `./usr/lib32/libGL.so.1.2': No such file or directory <-- seems to be the key error
maybe a corrupt copy? try apt-get clean; then apt-get install ia32-libs again (sudo both)
I thought of that at first too, did that a couple of time already no good same error, even downloaded the deb from several different locations with the same results
huh. you do anything weird to anything? like /etc/apt/* ?
I've not done anything odd, and other packages have installed without issues, did you want to see the contnets of /etc/apt/?
nah. you may require help from someone more skilled in the package system than I
all i can tell you is that I installed that package on a 64bit system a couple days ago and it worked :)
well thanks for trying, I'll keep asking hopefully someone will chime in
do you know where dpkg unpacks stuff to during the install? is there a temp location where files go prior to being moved to their final location?
i was thinking down the same path, but I don't know, and I havnt been able to figure it out
